Specific Details: SSE responded to the Draft Sligo County Council Development Plan 2017-2023 setting out its positions on a number of elements of the draft plan
DPOs Lobbied: Martin Baker|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Declan Bree|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Marie Casserly|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Michael Clarke|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Margaret Gormley|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Thomas Healy|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Hubert Keaney|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Seamus Kilgannon|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Jerry Lundy|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Seán MacManus|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Tom MacSharry|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Sinéad Maguire|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Dara Mulvey|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Seamus O'Boyle|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Rosaleen O'Grady|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Joseph Queenan|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Eamon Scanlon|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Paul Taylor|Councillor|Sligo County Council::Ciaran Hayes|CEO|Sligo County Council::Marie Leydon|Director of Services or Equivalent|Sligo County Council::Bartley Gavin|Director of Services or Equivalent|Sligo County Council::Tom Kilfeather|Director of Services or Equivalent|Sligo County Council::Dorothy Clarke|Director of Services or Equivalent|Sligo County Council::Marie Whelan|Head of Finance|Sligo County Council
Subject Matter: SSE responded to the Draft Sligo County Council Development Plan 2017-2023 setting out its positions on a number of elements of the draft plan
Intended Results: Welcomed the policy proposal to facilitate the roll-out of charging infrastructure for electric vehicles; outlined the need for a separate, stronger policy statement in relation to renewable energy aligned with national policy for decarbonisation; and outlined the need to consider how to maximise efficiencies from existing renewable and associated infrastructure through repowering and co-location.::SSE’s response also highlighted how the development of renewable energy is not only supportive of achieving our domestic and international climate targets but also represents an opportunity for economic, social and environmental benefits for the regions in which it is developed.

Specific Details: Amending the alcohol bill to reflect what was originally intended; before it entered the Seanad & was amended

Intended Results: Implement the alcohol bill in a effective manner as originally intended by government before it was amended in the Seanad.
